intro: Saurauia polyneura var. paucinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominently visible veins. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. This species is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in nutrient-poor soils.
